wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the System Overview focused on the nextjs-offline-whisper-to-llm application. Explain its purpose as an offline-first, browser-based audio transcription and AI introspection tool using Whisper and Ollama. Describe the architecture at a high level, emphasizing local processing for privacy, integration between frontend (Next.js) and backend (API routes), and the flow from audio upload to transcription to LLM analysis. Document the relationship between core components: UI (Application.tsx), API handlers (transcribe.ts, introspect.ts), and external dependencies (nodejs-whisper, ollama). Include practical examples such as uploading a WAV file and retrieving introspection results. Highlight use cases for researchers, content creators, and privacy-conscious users. Address common issues like environment setup failures and provide troubleshooting guidance. Discuss performance considerations for long audio files and model loading times.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend system of the application. Describe the component-based React architecture using Next.js App Router, focusing on the main Application.tsx component that manages global state (file selection, transcription, introspection, prompt). Explain the UI component hierarchy including layout (DefaultLayout), interactive controls (ActionUploadButton, Action), and display elements (TextArea, Copy, CircularLoader). Document the use of React hooks for state management and side effects, and how SCSS modules enable scoped styling. Detail the integration between UI components and data fetching via the queries.ts utility. Illustrate how user interactions trigger API calls and update component state. Include a diagram showing component relationships and data flow from user input to API communication. Address design decisions such as centralized state in Application.tsx, loading state management, and UI feedback mechanisms. Discuss accessibility considerations, responsive layout structure, and error handling patterns within the frontend.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audio Upload and Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Audio Upload and Management feature. Explain how users can upload audio files via the ActionUploadButton component in Application.tsx and how the file list is retrieved and displayed. Document the /api/upload endpoint that handles file ingestion and storage in the public directory, and the /api/list endpoint that returns available audio files. Include code examples showing the onSuccess callback in ActionUploadButton that refreshes the file list after upload. Describe the UI state management for uploading (uploading state) and file selection. Address common issues such as file format restrictions (WAV only), upload failures, and race conditions when multiple operations are triggered. Include performance considerations for handling large audio files and best practices for user feedback during long-running uploads.

wiki_catalogs.name: File Upload API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the file upload endpoint (POST /api/upload). Document the HTTP method, URL pattern, request headers (including X-API-KEY if applicable), and multipart form-data request body structure for audio file uploads. Specify accepted audio formats (WAV, MP3, etc.), maximum file size constraints, and server-side storage in the public directory. Detail the response schema including success (file ID, path) and error cases (invalid format, size exceeded). Include a curl example for uploading a WAV file and a client-side usage example using onUserUploadData from queries.ts. Address security considerations such as file type validation and prevention of path traversal attacks. Explain integration with the frontend Application.tsx component and how upload status is managed via state. Provide troubleshooting tips for common upload failures and performance guidance for large audio files.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Variables
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Environment Variables sub-section focused on runtime configuration. Document all critical environment variables including API_AES_KEY and API_IV_KEY used for decrypting authentication tokens from api.internet.dev, their purpose in enabling password recovery and Google OAuth, and security implications of exposing them. Explain how these variables are consumed in the decrypt() utility function within server.ts and the consequences of missing or invalid values. Provide setup instructions for developers, including how to obtain these keys through partnership with the service provider. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues such as decryption failures, invalid session keys, and authentication timeouts. Address best practices for securing these variables in production environments using .env files and secret management tools.

wiki_catalogs.name: Code Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Code Structure section focused on the project's directory organization and key files. Explain the purpose of each top-level directory: app/ (Next.js App Router components), pages/ (API routes and legacy pages), components/ (reusable UI with SCSS modules), common/ (shared utilities, hooks, queries), modules/ (low-level Node.js utilities), and scripts/ (Node.js processing scripts). Detail the role of critical files such as Application.tsx (main application state and UI orchestration), queries.ts (client-side API communication), server.ts (CORS, authentication, file handling utilities), and API route handlers (upload, transcribe, introspect). Provide examples from the codebase showing how frontend components invoke API routes via query functions. Illustrate the separation between client and server logic in a Next.js full-stack architecture. Address common structural anti-patterns to avoid when extending the codebase, such as placing business logic in components or duplicating utility functions. Include guidance on where to place new features based on their type (UI component, API endpoint, shared utility).

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Technology Stack section focused on the core frameworks and libraries powering the application. Detail the role of Next.js with App Router for full-stack rendering, React 19 for component-based UI, nodejs-whisper for local audio transcription, and Ollama for offline LLM inference. Explain how aes-js enables encryption, undici handles HTTP requests, and Sass manages styling. Document configuration specifics from next.config.js (port 10000) and tsconfig.json (TypeScript settings). Include practical examples of how these technologies interact, such as API routes using undici to communicate with Ollama's localhost service. Address integration challenges like ensuring Whisper CLI is available and Ollama models are properly pulled. Provide performance optimization tips, such as model selection (gemma3:27b) based on hardware capabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend system of the application. Describe the server-side architecture using Next.js API routes under pages/api/, detailing how each endpoint handles specific functionality (upload, transcribe, introspect, list, prompt management). Explain the role of server.ts in providing shared utilities like authentication checks and file system operations. Document the use of modules for low-level HTTP handling (cors, vary, object-assign). Detail the integration with external services: nodejs-whisper for local audio transcription and Ollama for LLM inference via HTTP calls to localhost:11434. Illustrate the data flow from API request to file system interaction and external process execution. Include a diagram showing request handling pipeline, authentication flow via api.internet.dev, and interaction with local AI models. Address security considerations including CORS enforcement, input validation, and authentication. Discuss performance implications of CPU-intensive operations (transcription/introspection) and state management through file system persistence. Cover error handling strategies and logging mechanisms in API routes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audio Transcription with Whisper
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Audio Transcription feature using Whisper. Explain the end-to-end process: user clicking 'Transcribe' in the UI, triggering the /api/transcribe API route which runs nodejs-whisper locally to convert audio to text, and storing the result as a .txt file in the public directory. Document how the /api/get-transcription endpoint retrieves the generated transcription and how Application.tsx manages transcribing state and displays results. Include code examples from Application.tsx showing the onClick handler for the Transcribe action and the use of Queries.getData to communicate with API routes. Address common issues like transcription accuracy, long processing times for large files, and error handling when Whisper fails. Include performance considerations such as CPU usage, memory requirements, and expected processing time based on audio duration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audio Transcription API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the transcription endpoints: POST /api/transcribe and GET /api/get-transcription. For transcribe, document the initiation of Whisper-based transcription by file ID, including request structure and asynchronous processing behavior. For get-transcription, detail the polling mechanism to retrieve the transcription text result once complete. Specify response formats including status (processing, completed, failed) and the final transcription text. Include examples of how Application.tsx triggers transcription and polls for results using query functions. Explain the server-side integration with nodejs-whisper and file system handling of .txt transcription outputs. Document error scenarios such as missing audio files or transcription failures. Provide performance expectations based on audio length and hardware capabilities. Include client implementation patterns for handling async transcription workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Settings
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Application Settings sub-section focused on static configuration and framework-level settings. Document the centralized configuration in constants.ts including MAX_SIZE_BYTES (15MB upload limit), API endpoint URL (https://api.internet.dev/api), and user tier definitions used for access control. Explain how these constants are imported and used across both frontend and backend components. Cover Next.js-specific configuration in next.config.js, particularly the disabled devIndicators for cleaner development experience. Detail how the port 10000 is set externally via package.json scripts rather than in configuration files. Provide examples of modifying the upload size limit and switching API endpoints for staging environments. Include performance considerations when adjusting MAX_SIZE_BYTES and implications of changing API URLs on CORS and authentication. Address common issues like file upload rejections and API connectivity errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contributing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Contributing section based on the project's README.md and package.json. Outline the complete contribution workflow: fork the repository, create a feature branch, implement changes following code style guidelines, and submit a pull request. Document all available npm scripts: 'local' (start development server on port 10000), 'llm' (launch Ollama with specific environment variables for model loading), and 'script' (run TypeScript scripts via ts-node for pipeline testing). Explain how to use these scripts during development and debugging. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the development environment on macOS, including installing dependencies via Homebrew (cmake, ffmpeg, ollama) and downloading the Whisper model. Include troubleshooting tips for common setup issues like missing whisper-cli or Ollama connection errors. Emphasize offline-first development practices and data privacy considerations. Offer best practices for testing new features, particularly around file handling and LLM interactions. Reference the contact information for maintainers in case contributors need assistance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Installation and Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Installation and Setup guide focused on preparing the development environment for macOS. Provide step-by-step instructions starting from cloning the repository to running the application. Include exact commands for installing dependencies via npm, setting up system tools (CMake, FFmpeg) using Homebrew, downloading the Whisper model (large-v3-turbo), and initializing Ollama with the correct environment variables (OLLAMA_LOAD_TIMEOUT, OLLAMA_KEEP_ALIVE). Document the required Ollama model pull command (ollama pull gemma3:27b) and how to start the Next.js server on port 10000. Use concrete examples from the README.md and package.json scripts. Address common setup issues such as missing Whisper CLI, Ollama service not starting, or port conflicts. Offer troubleshooting guidance and performance considerations for different hardware configurations, especially M4 MacBooks with 32GB RAM.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data flow documentation for the application. Map the complete lifecycle of data from user interaction to persistent storage and AI processing. Start with file upload flow: browser → API upload handler → public directory storage. Then trace transcription flow: file selection → transcribe API → nodejs-whisper execution → transcription file generation → UI display. Follow with introspection flow: transcription text → introspect API → Ollama LLM request → introspection file → UI rendering. Document prompt management flow: user edit → update-prompt API → prompt file update → subsequent introspection usage. Illustrate asynchronous operations and loading states managed in Application.tsx. Include sequence diagrams showing client-server interactions, highlighting how queries.ts abstracts API communication. Explain file naming conventions and synchronization between file list, transcription, and introspection states. Address race conditions, error recovery, and data consistency mechanisms. Discuss the role of the public directory as shared storage between frontend and backend processes. Provide examples of typical data payloads and their transformations throughout the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Introspection with Ollama
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI Introspection feature using Ollama. Explain how the system sends transcribed text to a locally running Ollama instance (via localhost:11434) to generate insightful analysis based on the default prompt. Document the /api/introspect endpoint that handles the LLM request and /api/get-introspection that retrieves stored introspection results. Use code examples from Application.tsx to show how the 'Introspect' button triggers the process, manages introspecting state, and displays results. Detail the integration with Ollama's API, including request formatting and response handling. Address common issues such as LLM response delays, model availability, and prompt effectiveness. Include performance considerations like inference time based on model size, hardware requirements, and strategies for optimizing prompt design to get better insights.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Introspection API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the AI introspection endpoints: POST /api/introspect and GET /api/get-introspection. Document how the introspect endpoint triggers Ollama LLM analysis of a transcription by file ID, including the use of the current prompt from get-prompt. Detail the asynchronous processing model and expected response structure upon completion. For get-introspection, specify the polling mechanism to retrieve the generated introspection text. Include examples of curl commands and client-side usage via Application.tsx state management. Explain the server-side flow from transcription retrieval to Ollama HTTP API call (localhost:11434) and result storage. Document error cases such as Ollama not running or prompt loading failures. Address performance considerations including LLM inference time and resource usage. Provide guidance on interpreting introspection results and handling long-running analysis tasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Extending Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for extending features in the application. Provide practical examples of adding new functionality, such as implementing a new API route for exporting introspection results or enhancing the UI with additional analysis options. Walk through the process of creating a new API endpoint in pages/api/, including proper error handling, file system operations, and integration with existing server utilities in common/server.ts. Demonstrate how to connect the new endpoint to the frontend by adding a query function in common/queries.ts and invoking it from Application.tsx using React hooks. Show how to extend the UI by creating new components in the components/ directory with SCSS modules for styling. Include examples from existing code patterns, such as the upload-transcribe-introspect workflow. Explain how to modify or add new scripts in the scripts/ directory for batch processing or automation tasks, referencing run.js as a template. Address security considerations when exposing new endpoints and performance implications of processing large audio files. Provide guidance on maintaining type safety across the TypeScript codebase when introducing new data structures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Core Features section covering the primary functionality of the application. Explain the end-to-end workflow: uploading audio files via the UI, storing them in the public directory, triggering transcription with Whisper, and analyzing transcripts using Ollama. Detail each sub-feature: file upload and listing (upload.ts, list.ts), transcription initiation and retrieval (transcribe.ts, get-transcription.ts), introspection generation and fetching (introspect.ts, get-introspection.ts), and prompt customization (update-prompt.ts, get-prompt.ts). Use code examples from Application.tsx to show state management and user interactions. Illustrate integration points between frontend components and API routes. Address common issues like file format support (WAV, MP3), transcription accuracy, and LLM response delays. Include performance considerations for large audio files and model inference times.

wiki_catalogs.name: Prompt Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Prompt Management feature. Explain how users can customize the LLM's behavior by editing the prompt in the UI and saving it via the /api/update-prompt endpoint, which writes the prompt to a file in the public directory. Document how the /api/get-prompt endpoint loads the current prompt on application startup and how Application.tsx maintains prompt state in React.useState. Include code examples showing the Prompt component (TextArea) bound to state and the 'Update Default Prompt' button handler. Address common issues such as prompt persistence across restarts, special characters in prompts, and ensuring the prompt file is properly formatted. Include best practices for crafting effective prompts for introspection tasks and how changing the prompt affects subsequent LLM analyses.

wiki_catalogs.name: Prompt Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the prompt management endpoints: GET /api/get-prompt and POST /api/update-prompt. Document how get-prompt retrieves the current LLM instruction text used for introspection, returning raw text content. For update-prompt, specify the request body format (plain text or JSON with 'prompt' field), server-side storage in the file system, and validation rules. Include curl examples for both retrieving and updating the prompt, as well as client-side usage patterns from Application.tsx. Explain the integration with the introspection workflow—how updated prompts affect subsequent AI analysis. Detail security considerations for text input handling and file storage. Provide troubleshooting guidance for prompt persistence issues and describe the default prompt initialization process. Include best practices for crafting effective introspection prompts for Ollama.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the application's frontend and backend systems. Describe the high-level design using component-based architecture (React) and client-server pattern via Next.js API routes. Document the separation of concerns: App Router components (app/), shared utilities (common/), UI components (components/), and API handlers (pages/api/). Explain data flows from user interaction in Application.tsx to server-side processing in API routes, including authentication via api.internet.dev and file system operations. Include system context diagrams showing how Whisper and Ollama integrate locally. Address technical decisions like using SCSS modules for styling and environment variables for configuration. Discuss scalability limitations due to local processing and deployment topology considerations for offline usage. Cover cross-cutting concerns such as error handling in server.ts and CORS configuration in modules/cors.ts.

wiki_catalogs.name: File Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the file listing endpoint GET /api/list. Document how this endpoint scans the public directory to return metadata about available audio files, transcriptions, and introspections. Specify the response schema including file IDs, names, timestamps, and status flags (transcribed, introspected). Include a curl example and demonstrate client-side usage via onUserListData in queries.ts. Explain how Application.tsx uses this data to populate the file selection interface. Address security considerations such as directory traversal prevention and exposure of file system paths. Discuss performance implications for large numbers of files and potential caching strategies. Provide troubleshooting tips for missing files or incorrect status reporting, and explain the naming convention linking audio files to their .txt and .txt.introspection counterparts.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the RESTful endpoints exposed by the Next.js API routes. For each endpoint (upload, transcribe, introspect, get-transcription, get-introspection, update-prompt, list, get-prompt), document HTTP methods (POST, GET), URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Specify input formats for audio uploads and prompt updates, and output structures for transcription and introspection text. Include examples of curl commands and client-side invocations using the functions in queries.ts. Document error responses and status codes. Address security considerations such as file upload validation and local execution risks. Provide client implementation guidelines for integrating with the API programmatically. Include performance tips like expected processing times for different audio lengths and rate limiting implications of local resource constraints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Configuration section focused on environment variables and application settings. Document all configurable parameters including OLLAMA_HOST (default localhost:11434), model names (e.g., gemma3:27b), file storage paths (public directory), and API timeouts. Explain how constants.ts centralizes configuration values used across the application. Detail server.ts utilities for handling CORS and request validation. Cover Next.js-specific settings in next.config.js such as port 10000. Provide examples of customizing the prompt template and changing the LLM model. Address common configuration issues like incorrect Ollama URLs or missing environment variables. Include performance considerations when adjusting timeout settings or switching between LLM models based on hardware capabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Development Guide focused on contributing to and extending the codebase. Explain the project structure with directories like app/, common/, components/, and pages/api/. Detail the purpose of each major file including Application.tsx (main UI), queries.ts (API clients), and server.ts (utilities). Provide guidelines for adding new features, such as implementing additional API routes or enhancing the UI. Document the contribution process outlined in README.md and available npm scripts (local, llm, script). Include practical examples of debugging API routes and testing UI components. Address common development issues like hot-reload failures or type errors in TypeScript. Offer performance optimization tips for both frontend rendering and backend processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Troubleshooting guide focused on diagnosing and resolving common issues. Cover setup problems (missing CMake, FFmpeg, or Whisper model), runtime errors (Ollama not responding, file upload failures), and API issues (CORS, malformed requests). Use examples from server.ts error handling and API route validations. Provide step-by-step debugging procedures, such as verifying Ollama service status, checking file permissions in public/, and inspecting browser console logs. Include solutions for specific error messages mentioned in the README.md. Address performance bottlenecks in transcription and introspection, offering mitigation strategies like using smaller LLM models or shorter audio clips. Document known limitations and workarounds for edge cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Advanced Usage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Advanced Usage focused on extending the application beyond basic functionality. Explain how to use the CLI scripts (run.js, index.js) for batch processing audio files and automating the transcription-introspection pipeline. Demonstrate advanced integrations such as customizing the prompt engineering workflow or chaining multiple LLM analyses. Show how to modify the UI in Application.tsx for enhanced user experiences. Include examples of using ts-node to execute scripts with specific TypeScript configurations. Address extension possibilities like adding export functionality, supporting new audio formats, or integrating alternative transcription engines. Provide performance optimization techniques for handling large datasets and memory management during prolonged usage.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: NextJS Offline Whisper to LLM

## 1. Project Introduction

This NextJS application enables offline audio transcription and AI-powered introspection using Whisper and Ollama. The system allows users to upload audio files, transcribe them locally using Whisper, and then analyze the transcriptions with a large language model (LLM) for deeper insights.

**Core Goals:**
- Provide an offline-capable audio transcription solution
- Enable AI-driven analysis of transcribed content
- Create a seamless user interface for managing audio processing workflows

**Target Audience:**
- Developers working with audio transcription
- Researchers analyzing spoken content
- Content creators needing automated transcription and analysis
- Privacy-conscious users requiring offline processing

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a layered architecture with clear separation between frontend components, API routes, and utility modules.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Interface] --> B[API Layer]
    B --> C[Whisper Transcription]
    B --> D[Ollama LLM Processing]
    C --> E[File Storage]
    D --> F[Prompt Management]
    E --> G[Public Directory]
    F --> H[Prompt Files]
```

### Design Patterns

The project implements several key design patterns:

- **Modular Architecture**: Components, common utilities, and API routes are separated into distinct directories
- **Client-Server Pattern**: API routes handle server-side processing while React components manage client-side interactions
- **State Management**: React hooks manage application state in the `Application.tsx` component
- **Configuration-as-Code**: Environment variables and constants are centralized in dedicated modules

### System Relationships

```mermaid
graph TD
    App[Application Component] --> Layout[DefaultLayout]
    App --> Upload[ActionUploadButton]
    App --> Loader[CircularLoader]
    App --> Text[TextArea]
    App --> API[API Queries]
    API --> UploadAPI[/api/upload]
    API --> TranscribeAPI[/api/transcribe]
    API --> IntrospectAPI[/api/introspect]
    API --> ListAPI[/api/list]
    UploadAPI --> Whisper[nodejs-whisper]
    IntrospectAPI --> Ollama[Ollama LLM]
    Whisper --> Public[public/ directory]
    Ollama --> Public
```

### Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Uploads Audio] --> B[API Upload Handler]
    B --> C[Save to Public Directory]
    C --> D[Whisper Transcription]
    D --> E[Text File Output]
    E --> F[User Interface Display]
    F --> G[User Requests Introspection]
    G --> H[API Introspect Handler]
    H --> I[Ollama LLM Processing]
    I --> J[Introspection File]
    J --> K[Display Results]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `app/page.tsx`: Main application page with metadata generation
- `components/Application.tsx`: Core application component with state management
- `pages/api/*.ts`: Server-side API endpoints for various operations

### Core Modules
- `common/constants.ts`: Application constants and configuration
- `common/server.ts`: Server utilities including CORS and API helpers
- `common/queries.ts`: API query functions for client-server communication
- `common/utilities.ts`: Utility functions for common operations

### Configuration Approach
- `next.config.js`: NextJS configuration
- `package.json`: Project dependencies and scripts
- `tsconfig.json`: TypeScript configuration
- Environment variables for API keys and security settings

### External Dependencies
- `next`: React framework for server-rendered applications
- `nodejs-whisper`: Local audio transcription using Whisper
- `ollama`: Local LLM inference
- `aes-js`: Encryption/decryption utilities
- `undici`: HTTP client for API requests

### Integration Points
- Whisper API for audio transcription
- Ollama API for LLM processing
- External API at `api.internet.dev` for user authentication
- File system integration for audio and text storage

```mermaid
graph LR
    Frontend[React Frontend] --> API[NextJS API Routes]
    API --> Whisper[Whisper Transcription]
    API --> Ollama[Ollama LLM]
    Whisper --> FileSystem[public/ directory]
    Ollama --> FileSystem
    API --> ExternalAPI[api.internet.dev]
    ExternalAPI --> Authentication[User Authentication]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview

The application provides a complete workflow for audio processing and analysis:

1. **Audio Upload**: Users can upload WAV files through the interface
2. **Transcription**: Uploaded audio is transcribed to text using Whisper
3. **Introspection**: Transcribed text is analyzed by an LLM for deeper insights
4. **Prompt Management**: Users can customize the prompts used for LLM analysis
5. **File Management**: Users can browse and select from uploaded audio files

### Implementation Highlights

The application implements a sophisticated audio processing pipeline that combines local transcription with AI analysis. The UI provides clear feedback during long-running operations like transcription and introspection, which can take several minutes.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> Uploading: Upload Audio
    Uploading --> Transcribing: Process Audio
    Transcribing --> Transcribed: Complete
    Transcribed --> Introspecting: Request Analysis
    Introspecting --> Analyzed: Complete
    Analyzed --> Idle: Ready
    state "Long Operations" as LongOps
    LongOps: Transcribing
    LongOps: Introspecting
    LongOps --> ShowLoader: Display CircularLoader
```

The system handles large audio files (up to ~15MB) and manages the asynchronous nature of transcription and LLM processing with appropriate loading states and error handling.

Sources:
- [page.tsx](app/page.tsx)
- [Application.tsx](components/Application.tsx)
- [upload.ts](pages/api/upload.ts)
- [transcribe.ts](pages/api/transcribe.ts)
- [introspect.ts](pages/api/introspect.ts)
- [server.ts](common/server.ts)
- [constants.ts](common/constants.ts)
</blog>
